comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: The caption underneath the picture 'Hubert Latham in his Antoinnet Monoplane is not correct as the monoplane in the middle is not an 'Antoinette' (sic) but an early version of the Blériot Type XI monoplane. As far as I know Hubert Latham never flew for Blériot but only for the Levavasseur firm, the designer and builder of the Antoinette monoplanes. At right is a Curtiss biplane. Presumably the picture is taken at an early flying week (1909 or 1910 ?) also evidenced by the seats visible at the left side.
